articles.title: Eliot Wong-Toi
articles.contents:
Welcome to my website. I hope you enjoy it!
I am a fourth-year PhD student in statistics at UC Irvine where I am advised by
Professor Stephan Mandt. I
previously received a B.S. in Mathematics-Computer Science from UC San
Diego in 2019.
My research interests lie in Bayesian deep learning.

articles.title: Miscellaneous Projects
articles.contents:
Projects
Fuel
Efficiency
Used a linear model to analyze the fuel efficiency of SP98 and E10
fuel. The data came from a single driver’s personal log of trips in a
single vehicle over the course of a year.

Coronavirus
Reproduction Number
Class project with Isaac Goldstein estimating the reproduction
number for coronavirus in Hubei province fit to data from early 2020. We
applied the technique of linear noise approximation to data from early
2020 and fit a susceptible-infectious-recovered (SIR) model.

articles.title: Research
articles.description: Some more about my research experience and interests.
articles.contents:
UC Irvine
Uncertainty Quantification
Developing techniques techniques for fitting Bayesian neural
networks to heteroskedastic data with Professor Stephan Mandt.

Sports Analytics
Analyzing NBA shot chart data with Professor Weining Shen and
Professor Guanyu
Hu to cluster players based on offensive contributions.
Wong-Toi, E., Yang, H.-C., Shen, W., and Hu, G. (2022) A Joint
Analysis for Field Goal Attempts and Percentages of Professional
Basketball Players: Bayesian Nonparametric Resource. Journal of Data
Science Link


Micro-Randomized Trials with Binary Outcomes
Co-wrote MRTSampleSizeBinary package
and Shiny app
for power and sample size calculations in the context of
micro-randomized trials with binary outcomes with Thabat Dahdoul under
the direction of Professor Tianchen Qian.
The formula that is implemented in this package and shiny app is
developed in “Sample Size
Considerations for Micro-Randomized Trials with Binary Outcome”
which is currently a work in progress.

Radiomics
Worked with Professor Michele Guindani in
collaboration with UC Davis medical doctors to analyze radiomic data for
predicting skin cancer. Used Bayesian methods to perform variable
selection and fit logistic regression models to provide quantitative
evidence for examining certain traits in imaging data.

UC San Diego
Medical Imaging
Implemented convolutional neural network for lung segmentation in
MRI images in the UCSD Pulmonary Imaging Lab under the supervision of
Professor Rui
Carlos Pereira de Sa. This tool was to be put in the post-processing
pipeline of MRI data.
